content: If this box is checked, {{sectionName}} users will not need to verify their email after the first authorization in {{productName}}.

comment.text: This translation key is used to describe the behavior of disabling email verification for users. It explains that when this option is enabled, users won't need to verify their email after initial authorization in the product. This appears as a help text on settings pages related to LDAP and Single Sign-On integration.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'first authorization' is translated as 'أول تفويض'. While technically correct, a more natural and common phrasing in this context would be 'تسجيل الدخول الأول' (first login) or 'الترخيص الأول' (first licensing). 'تفويض' implies a more complex delegation of authority.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: إذا تم تحديد هذا الخيار، فلن يُطلب من مستخدمي {{sectionName}} التحقق من بريدهم الإلكتروني بعد تسجيل الدخول الأول في {{productName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Azerbaijani phrase "ehtiyac qalmayacaq" is slightly awkward. A more natural phrasing would be "ehtiyacı olmayacaq".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bu xana işarələnərsə, {{sectionName}} istifadəçilərinin {{productName}} məhsulunda ilkin avtorizasiyadan sonra e-poçtlarını doğrulamasına ehtiyacı olmayacaq.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation uses "Kontrollkästchen" instead of a more common term for a checkbox, like "Checkbox" or "Häkchen". While technically correct, it might sound less natural to a native speaker in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'Checkbox' or 'Häkchen' instead of 'Kontrollkästchen' for better readability and a more common usage.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'εξουσιοδότηση' (exousiodotisi) while technically meaning authorization, might be too formal or less common in everyday language for this context. A more natural translation of 'authorization' in this context could be 'εγγραφή' (egrapi) or 'δημιουργία λογαριασμού' (dimiourgia logariasmou).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider replacing 'εξουσιοδότηση' with 'εγγραφή' or 'δημιουργία λογαριασμού'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of '{{sectionName}}' and '{{productName}}' is correct for placeholders, but it's important to ensure these are replaced with the actual values during implementation. Confirm that the values being inserted are appropriate for Greek language usage and syntax.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify that the values being substituted for '{{sectionName}}' and '{{productName}}' are properly localized and grammatically correct in Greek.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The colon and space after '{{productName}}' are unnecessary in Finnish. It breaks the sentence flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Jos tämä laatikko on valittu, {{sectionName}} – käyttäjien ei tarvitse vahvistaa sähköpostiosoitettaan {{productName}} ensimmäisen valtuutuksen jälkeen.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "չեն ստիպված լինի հաստատել իրենց էլ. փոստը" is a bit awkward and could be improved for clarity. A more natural phrasing would convey that users *do not need* to verify their email.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Եթե այս վանդակը նշված է, ապա {{sectionName}} օգտատերերը չեն պետք է հաստատեն իրենց էլ. փոստը առաջին մուտքից հետո {{productName}}-ում։

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "メールを確認する必要がありません" (meeru o kakunin suru hitsuyou ga arimasen) is a bit formal and passive. A more natural translation would be something along the lines of "メール認証が不要になります" (meeru kakunin ga fuyou ni narimasu) which means 'email verification becomes unnecessary'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: このボックスがチェックされている場合、{{sectionName}} ユーザーは {{productName}} で最初の認証後にメール認証が不要になります。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase '이 상자를 선택하면' (if this box is selected) is slightly awkward in this context. A more natural phrasing would be '이 확인란을 선택하면' or '체크 박스를 선택하면'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 이 확인란을 선택하면

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word '인증' (authorization/authentication) is repeated and feels unnatural. It's more natural to use a synonym or rephrase.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 이 확인란을 선택하면 {{sectionName}} 사용자는 {{productName}}에서 첫 번째 가입 후 이메일 인증이 필요 없습니다.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ຖືກກວດແລ້ວ" (tuk gwad laew) is not the best translation for "checked." A more natural phrasing would convey the action of checking the box. "ຖືກເລືອກແລ້ວ" (tuk leuak laew) or simply "ຖືກສະຫຼາກແລ້ວ" (tuk salak laew) might be better options.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຖ້າກ່ອງນີ້ຖືກສະຫຼາກແລ້ວ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'ການອະນຸມັດຄັ້ງທໍາອິດ' (kaan a-noo-mat khang tham-it) for 'first authorization' is somewhat formal. A more conversational translation might be preferred, depending on the tone of the product.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ການລົງທະບຽນຄັ້ງທໍາອິດ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "pārbaudīt savu e-pastu" is a literal translation of "verify their email" but sounds unnatural in Latvian. A more natural phrasing would be "apstiprināt savu e-pastu" or "aktivizēt savu e-pastu".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ja šis lodziņš ir atzīmēts, {{sectionName}} lietotājiem pēc pirmās autorizācijas {{productName}} nebūs nepieciešams apstiprināt savu e-pastu.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation uses 'Jeśli dane pole jest zaznaczone' which is a bit verbose. A more natural phrasing would be 'Jeśli zaznaczone'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Jeśli zaznaczone

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'endereço de correio eletrónico' is a very literal and somewhat formal translation of 'email address'. A more natural and commonly used term in Portuguese would be 'endereço de email'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: endereço de email

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Dacă această casetă de selectare este bifată" is overly literal and sounds unnatural in Romanian. A more natural phrasing would be "Dacă este bifată această căsuță" or "Dacă bifezi această căsuță".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Dacă este bifată această căsuță

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "nu trebuie să își verifice adresa de e-mail" is grammatically correct, it could be improved for clarity and flow.  A more natural phrasing would be "nu mai trebuie să verifice adresa de e-mail" or "nu vor trebui să își verifice adresa de e-mail".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: nu mai trebuie să verifice adresa de e-mail

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation uses "флажок" which is a bit formal for a checkbox. A more natural phrasing might be used.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Если установлен этот пункт/переключатель, пользователям...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, "подтверждать адрес электронной почты" is a bit verbose. A more concise option would be preferred. 'Verify email' often translates to something shorter in Russian.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Если установлен этот флажок, пользователям {{sectionName}} не нужно будет подтверждать свой email после первой авторизации в {{productName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'අවසරයෙන්' is spelled incorrectly. It should be 'පහසු කිරීමෙන්'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: පහසු කිරීමෙන්

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure can be improved for better readability. The current structure 'මෙම කොටුව සලකුණු කරන්නේ නම්... අවශ්‍ය නොවනු ඇත' is a bit awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: මෙම කොටුව සලකුණු කළොත්, {{productName}} හි පළමු අවසරයෙන් {{sectionName}} පරිශීලකයින්ට ඔවුන්ගේ විද්‍යුත් ලිපිනය සත්‍යාපනය කිරීමට අවශ්‍ය නොවනු ඇත.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovenian translation uses a direct translation of "If this box is checked" as "Če je to polje označeno". While technically correct, a more natural phrasing in a user interface context might be "Če je ta potrditveni okvir/škatlica/polje označeno" or simply "Če je potrditveni okvir/škatlica/polje označeno". The specific term depends on the UI design.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a more idiomatic translation for UI contexts such as "Če je ta potrditveni okvir/škatlica/polje označeno" or "Če je potrditveni okvir/škatlica/polje označeno".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'штиклирана' is not the most natural translation of 'checked' in this context. It's technically correct but sounds a bit formal/technical.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ако је ова кутија означена...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "If this box is checked" is translated as "Bu kutu işaretlenirse". While technically correct, a more natural Turkish phrasing would be "Bu onay kutusu seçilirse" or "Bu kutucuk işaretlenirse".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bu onay kutusu seçilirse

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "will not need to verify" is translated as "gerekmez".  While accurate, a smoother and more idiomatic Turkish translation would be "doğrulama yapmasına gerek kalmayacak".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: doğrulama yapmasına gerek kalmayacak

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The placement of the variables {{sectionName}} and {{productName}} feels slightly awkward in the Ukrainian sentence. While technically correct, it could be improved for a more natural flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing to integrate the variables more seamlessly, e.g., 'Якщо цей прапорець встановлено, користувачі {{productName}} у {{sectionName}} не потребуватимуть підтвердження електронної пошти після першої авторизації.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'ủy quyền' is not the most natural or common way to express 'authorization' in this context. 'Xác thực' or 'phép' might be better alternatives depending on the specific nuance.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Nếu mục này được chọn, người dùng {{sectionName}} sẽ không cần xác minh email của họ sau lần xác thực đầu tiên trong {{productName}}.
